      • list

        @RequestMapping(value="/list")
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasAuthority(\'manager\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<com.toptal.entrance.alexeyz.domain.User>> list()
        GET /rest/user/list

        You must have Manager authority to call this method
        Returns:
        List of all users as JSON

      • create

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity create(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                com.toptal.entrance.alexeyz.domain.User user)
        POST /rest/user/

        No authorization required for this method (everyone can create user and use it later for accessing API)
        Parameters:
        user - User object as JSON
        Returns:
        Created User as JSON; 400 if login already exist, login or pwd are too short/long, on attempt to create Manager/Admin if current user is not Manager/Admin

      • delete

        @PreAuthorize(value="hasAuthority(\'manager\')")
 @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=DELETE)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity delete(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                                                                                                         long id)
        DELETE /rest/user/{id}

        Delete user with the given id
        Parameters:
        id - Id of user in the system
        Returns:
        HTTP OK; 400 on attempt to delete Admin or yourself

      • update

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=PUT)
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasAuthority(\'manager\')")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity update(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                  com.toptal.entrance.alexeyz.domain.User user)
        PUT /rest/user/

        Update the given user (based on id)
        Parameters:
        user - User object as JSON
        Returns:
        HHTP OK; 404 if user not found, 400 if login or pwd are too short/long, on attempt to create Manager/Admin if current user is not Manager/Admin
